TopicTitle: Is the center of the lift supposed to be tilted forward?

Articles.Content: I don't recall ever seeing a picture of someone else's center of lift being tilted forward, it might supposed to be there but i don't know. Does anyone know if it should be tilted or not?
Mine is always tilted forward in KSP. Don't know why

From what I've read and noticed, the CoL being pointed off vertical shows that you have a lift imbalance. Try rotating some of your lifting surfaces in 5 deg increments (hold Shift while tapping w/a/s/d/q/e) to bring it as close to straight up as possible - this will give you a more stable craft.
If your main wings, tailwings, canards, etc are not proportionally sized, then you can have an imbalance result. If any of your lifting surfaces are angled, this too can produce the same effect.
No this happens no matter what, ive taken all of the wings off until i have only 1 on each side, and its always tilted forward
try using either shift + w/a/s/d keys if still nothing try putting your wings back of the plane well if it does not work at all you must have Jeb flying your plane.
Has it actually affected your flight? I've seen this too but haven't encountered any problems.
